document.name: CHomeViewCtrl

group.heading: GET CONNECTED
group.text: You are not currently connected to any peer-to-peer networks.

group.heading: START DOWNLOAD
group.text: downloading a new file or torrent.
group.heading: SEARCH FOR A FILE
WARNING: YOU ARE FIREWALLED
group.text: PeerProject has detected that you are behind a NAT router or firewall, and are unable to receive connections from the Internet.
This may cause poor download and search performance.
group.link: Click here to learn how to configure your router or firewall

group.heading: WARNING: YOUR TCP PORT IS FIREWALLED
group.text: PeerProject has detected that you are behind a NAT router or firewall, and are unable to receive TCP connections from the Internet.
This may cause poor download performance.
group.link: Click here to learn how to configure your router or firewall

group.heading: WARNING: YOUR UDP PORT IS FIREWALLED
group.text: PeerProject has detected that you are behind a NAT router or firewall, and are unable to receive UDP messages from the Internet.
This may cause poor search performance.
group.link: Click here to learn how to configure your router or firewall

document.heading: CUSTOMIZE PEERPROJECT
document.text: - Change PeerProject's look & feel
- Quick edit PeerProject's basic settings
- Update blocklist to avoid bad search results
- Get online support using PeerProject

document.name: CGeneralSettingsGroup
document.title: General
document.text: Welcome to PeerProject's Settings Manager
The PeerProject Settings Manager allows advanced users to completely customize how PeerProject works. The settings in the
General
section relate to the user experience.
Common user interface settings like tooltips, minimize behavior, number formats, prompts, etc.
Presentation, file access, and management of the file library.
Set when to use the internal PeerProject Media Center.
Your profile and direct chat settings.
IRC chatroom visual appearance and connection settings.
Integrate PeerProject with your web browser to accept peer-to-peer links and download content.

document.name: CInternetSettingsGroup
document.title: Internet
document.text: Welcome to PeerProject's Settings Manager
The PeerProject Settings Manager allows advanced users to completely customize how PeerProject works. The settings in the
Internet
section control how PeerProject interacts with other nodes in distributed peer-to-peer networks.
The speeds and capabilities of your Internet connection.
Download throughput, scheduling, verification, timeouts and management.
Upload capacity, queuing, banning, timeouts and special requests.
Set up the ability to control PeerProject remotely through a web browser.
Limit download connections based on a periodic schedule.

document.name: CBrowseHostProfile.2
document.text: Shared Files

document.name: DownloadHelp.Select
document.text: Downloads Area
This is where files currently being downloaded are displayed. You can view individual sources by expanding each file with the small toggle to the left.
Drag'n'Drop downloads higher in the list for priority, or onto Download Group tabs for better organization (in Power Mode).
You can also use this command to get help information on a specific download. Simply select a download and choose this Help command again.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Seeding
document.text: This Torrent is Seeding
PeerProject has verified this complete download, and is actively sharing it with other downloaders through BitTorrent. Share 100% before closing.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Completed
document.text: This Download has Completed
PeerProject has finished downloading this file, and has verified that it is 100% correct. It has also moved the file to your downloads folder.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Moving
document.text: This Download is Moving
PeerProject has finished downloading this file, and has verified that it is correct. It is currently being moved and/or unpacked to your downloads folder.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Paused
document.text: This Download is Paused
You have paused this download. If you want it to resume downloading, you can click the '
Resume Download
' command.

document.name: DownloadHelp.DiskFull
document.text: The Disk is Full

PeerProject has paused this download automatically because the hard disk appears to be full, or the download file cannot be written to. If you wish to continue downloading, please free some space on your hard disk and/or check to make sure the incomplete file folder is accessible, and then resume the download.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Verifying
document.text: This Download is Verifying
This download has finished, and PeerProject is now checking it to ensure that it is exactly the same as the original file. If any damaged parts are found, PeerProject will repair them automatically.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Downloading
document.text: This Download is Active
This download is currently in progress. If it is downloading too slowly, you could try searching the network for more sources with the '
Find More Sources
' command. If the speed does not improve it may be due to limited upload speeds of the users you are downloading from. Download speed usually increases over time.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Pending
document.text: This Download is Pending

This download is waiting for someone to start uploading. PeerProject is ready to start downloading this file, but no-one is sending it at the moment. You are probably waiting in other user's queues, and the download may start transferring at any time. You can examine the individual sources to see each queue you are waiting in. If you are sharing files yourself, it may improve the chances of a download transfer starting quickly.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Queued
document.text: This Download is Queued

This download is waiting for some of your other downloads to complete. Your download settings limit the number of downloads which may be active at any given time, to ensure that each download gets a good share of the available bandwidth. You can change these settings via Tools, PeerProject Settings. Alternatively, you may manually start this download with the resume command.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Searching
document.text: This Download is Searching

There are no known sources for this download, so PeerProject is searching all connected P2P networks for new sources. Once sources are found, the download will start automatically. PeerProject searches for sources automatically, however you can speed up the process using the
Find More Sources
command.

Unfortunately in many cases there may be no users online who have the file you are looking for. The only course of action here is to wait for someone to come online, or cancel it and try to find a similar file which is more widely available.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Creating
document.text: This Download is Creating
PeerProject is pre-allocating a file in which to store this download, to save time later.

document.name: DownloadHelp.Tracker
document.text: BitTorrent Tracker Down
The BitTorrent tracker server for this download appears to be down or malfunctioning. PeerProject is unable to contact it to receive a list of peers.

document.name: UploadHelp
document.text: Uploads Area
This is where queues and uploads are displayed. You can expand each queue with the small + on the left, and filter what is displayed with the button on the right of the window's toolbar.

document.name: GeneralHelp.DiskSpace
document.text: Disk Space is Low
The amount of free space on one or more drives used by PeerProject is low.

You should always attempt to keep a reasonable amount of disk space free. Programs can become unstable if the drives become full, and temporary files may be lost. You should run a disk clean-up, delete unwanted files, or uninstall software you no longer need.

document.name: GeneralHelp.DiskWriteFail
document.text: A Required Directory is Non-writable
A disk or directory PeerProject needs cannot be written to.
A network drive may have been disconnected, or you may not have write permission to a selected directory. Please check directories and permissions, or change the temporary files location.

document.name: GeneralHelp.ConnectionFail
document.text: Internet Connection Has Been Lost
Windows reports that there is no internet connection is available.
It is likely that a modem or router has dropped, meaning the internet cannot be accessed. You may need to manually re-connect or reset your connection.
PeerProject has ceased connection attempts to avoid losing all cached hosts.

document.name: GeneralHelp.AdultFilter
document.text: Adult content filter enabled
Please note that (as with any automated filter) it may not be 100% effective at screening content. It is designed simply to filter out excess unwanted results, rather than as a 100% safe block.
Children's Internet use (including P2P file sharing) should always be under parental supervision.

document.name: GeneralHelp.BadTorrentEncoding
document.text: Torrent encoding error detected

Windows has reported a 'translation fault' while decoding text in this torrent. The torrent file may be corrupt, or just incorrectly encoded (often mixed Linux data). The target file itself can most likely still be downloaded.
Many torrent creation programs should allow you to repair this torrent, which will ensure it works properly in all BitTorrent applications.
, or to download software to repair the torrent.

document.name: GeneralHelp.DonkeyServerList
document.text: Your eDonkey server list is empty
There are no servers in your eDonkey server list. You need to download an up to date server list (met file) to connect to ED2K.
You can download a server list from the ed2k setting page, or the discovery services window. (Press F9 to open the discovery services window)

document.name: GeneralHelp.UploadWarning
document.text: Limiting uploads may slow downloads
Several networks PeerProject connects to enforce ratios, limit uploads to clients that do not share, or simply preference uploading to known sharers.

Fortunately, broadband DSL connections are like a two-lane highway: you have separate allocations for upload and download. If your client is properly configured, you should be able to upload at a good rate while retaining full download capacity.
By default, your upload limit is set to about 85% of available upstream bandwidth, while downloads are unlimited. That configuration should give you the fastest possible downloads that are available.

document.name: SearchHelp.BadSearch1
document.text: Please re-phrase the search

This search is poorly formatted, and may not function correctly. Searches should include several terms where possible, and should specify a schema (file type). Furthermore, searches must not be limited to numbers or negative terms only, and you should avoid overly general queries.
Most clients on the network will ignore a search for all MP3 files, for example, because it is not specific enough, and would generate too many results.

document.name: SearchHelp.BadSearch2
document.text: Please re-phrase the search
This search does not contain enough terms to function properly. All searches need a minimum number of valid, alphabetic characters to be able to start.

While common file extensions (and numbers) can be searched for, you must enter other terms as well when creating the search. Punctuation and wildcards are not used in searches, just the text you enter.

document.name: SearchHelp.BadSearch3
document.text: Please re-phrase the search
This search seems to contain only common file extensions, or no searchable words.
If you are having trouble creating searches, keep in mind that it's quite similar to a web search. Specific terms or phrases are best- Unique names, titles and keywords.
General terms cannot be searched for efficiently and may result in poor search performance, as well as high bandwidth use during searches.
Further help is available on the PeerProject web site.

document.name: SearchHelp.AdultSearch
document.text: This search cannot be started
The specified search would likely return a large number of results with adult content, and this option has been turned off. You should either re-phrase the search, or disable the filter.
To disable the filter, go into Tools > Settings > General and uncheck the adult content filter.

document.name: ShareHelp.AlreadyShared
document.text: Already Shared
The folder you have selected is already being shared as part of an existing share.
%s

document.name: ShareHelp.BadShare
document.text: This folder should not be shared
This folder is (or contains) a system folder. Sharing this folder is not recommended, since most of the files in it are of no use to other people.
Folders such as the Windows directory, Program Files, and similar folders do not usually contain files suitable for sharing. Any files of interest would be in sub-folders located
inside
these folders. Please share those instead.
The PeerProject 'incomplete' folder should also not be shared through the library, as attempting to hash downloads in progress may impact performance.

Enter regular expressions in perl syntax.{n}The search keywords can be specified in a form of <n>, where n is number between 1 and 9. If you want to put all keywords each after other, use <_> markup.

This setting has no effect on downloads previously started, also this setting is ignored if the file have the eDonkey hash and the eDonkey network is enabled or if it is a torrent.{n}However this setting isn't ignored if the download is paused.{n}{n}ATTENTION: Use this option only in case of real necessity, if you abuse of the option you may be banned.

Forcing your PC into hub mode may have adverse effects on performance and the P2P network. It is generally better to allow PeerProject to decide whether or not hub mode should be used.

Hub mode does NOT produce better search results, or have any other advantages for you.

Do you really want to do this, despite these disadvantages?
Disabling support for Gnutella-1 protocols may limit your search results, and if you are acting as a hub it may also impact upon the results of other users. Are you sure you want to do this?
Gnutella2 is PeerProject's premiere network. Disabling support for it may severely limit both the number and quality of your search results. Are you SURE you want to do this?
Your outgoing bandwidth is too low to enable this network

Including your downloaded files folder in your library makes it easier to view and organize new downloads, and lets you take advantage of advanced PeerProject features such as download verification and automatic upgrading. Placing downloaded files in your library does not necessarily require you to share them: you can choose whether or not to share files independently.

Use the PeerProject Media Player to ENQUEUE the file types listed below

You can use your Gnutella User Profile to share information about yourself, your interests and recommended files and websites with others.
Enable peer to peer chat with compatible clients
Enable chat on all protocols where possible
Use PeerProject to open these types of links:
Use PeerProject to manage all my web downloads:
The download manager plugin will only attempt to download file types listed here. Other file types will be handled by your web browser. PeerProject must be running to manage downloads.
Only download and upload to networks which are connected.

PeerProject Remote Access allows you to leave PeerProject running on your PC, and control it remotely using a web browser. You will need to be able to accept incoming connections to use this feature (i.e. properly configured router, etc).

The scheduler is designed to allow you to set times when PeerProject will connect and download files. {n}{n}{n}Note: If you have PeerProject open while the scheduler is active, you may see it changing settings- This is normal.

PeerProject is a general-purpose file-sharing application that can access many P2P networks at the same time. On this page you can select which P2P networks you want to connect to, and then adjust specific settings for each network.
The Gnutella2 network is PeerProject's premiere network, offering more features and performance than any other P2P net. Highly recommended.
The original Gnutella network is less feature-rich than Gnutella2, and has fewer files than eDonkey, yet remains a valuable resource.
The eDonkey network is a popular server-based network. While not as feature-rich or fast as G2, eMule has an impressive file collection.
Search known remote servers in the server cache:
Receive and update server list from the connected server
Download eDonkey server list from the web:
Clear downloaded torrents When the share ratio reaches
Enable EndGame mode when completing torrents
This QuickStart wizard can help you configure your software in a few simple steps, even if you haven't used PeerProject or other P2P client before.
More advanced users can access the full range of PeerProject's options via the Tools menu. Click Exit to close the wizard at any time.
This wizard will assist you to:
Tell PeerProject about your Internet connection
Connect to your choice of P2P networks, and
For best performance, PeerProject needs to know about your connection to the Internet.
Choose the type of your Internet connection:
P2P networks are only as good as the people who use them. All of the content available for download is being shared by another user.
You do not have to share content to use PeerProject, however some software will restrict users who are not sharing anything.
Please indicate which folders, if any, you wish to share. Click the Add button to include a new folder, files can be unshared later.
CAUTION: Uploading unlicensed copyright works is liable in most countries.
PeerProject is a friendlier place when everyone shares a few basic details about themselves. Full profile is available from the Tools menu.
PeerProject supports a flexible user interface, so you can choose what is most comfortable for you. You can change these options at any time.
Simple, easy to use menus with fewer options.{n}Helpful for new users of file sharing.
Normal mode offers users all extra commands, windows, etc.{n}Might be more confusing for new users.
Display simplified download progress bars. (May be less confusing)

PeerProject is a general-purpose file-sharing application that can access many P2P networks at the same time. Here you can select which networks you'd like to access. Note that you can always select different networks later.
The Gnutella2 network (G2) is PeerProject's premiere network, offering more features and performance than any other P2P net. (Shareaza)
The original Gnutella network (G1) is less feature-rich than Gnutella2, with less files than ED2K, yet remains a valuable source. (LimeWire)
The eDonkey network (ED2K) is a popular server-based network. While not as feature-rich or fast as G2, ED2K has a vast file collection. (eMule)
PeerProject has detected that you have another eDonkey program installed on your computer. Would you like to import any unfinished downloads into PeerProject?
That's it. PeerProject has been configured to work with your computer.
If you ever need to change your settings, you can re-run this QuickStart wizard by selecting it from the Tools menu.
After closing this wizard by clicking Finish, you can connect to the networks you selected and start searching and downloading content.
Connect to the network when I close this wizard
Connect to the network every time I start PeerProject
Start PeerProject every time Windows starts
Allow others to browse my user profile
Other users browsing your profile and shared files will see your avatar. Custom avatars should be 128x128 pixels, and can be in any supported image file on your PC.
Favorite files are recommended to users who browse your profile. You can create favorite files by adding them to the "Favorites" library folder.

Users are identified by a globally unique identifier and a corresponding public and private key pair. Normally there is no need to generate a new ID, however PeerProject provides this option for advanced users.
Initiate a new connection to host or server:|Browse this host:
Downloading any file with PeerProject is easy. Simply type or paste the URL or URI describing the file into the box below and press Enter.
PeerProject can download files from the web (HTTP), and automatically search and download P2P links (Magnet, Gnutella, eDonkey, mP2P).

PeerProject can also download BitTorrent files. A torrent can be described by a .torrent file, or a HTTP link to the .torrent file. To download a torrent HTTP link, paste it in the box above. If you already have a .torrent file, click Open Torrent:

Did you know PeerProject is a 100% free product?

PeerProject does NOT contain ANY "spyware", "adware" or other bundled software. It does NOT display any advertisements or "popups", ever.{n}{n}If you ever see advertising or "popups" while using PeerProject, be assured that they are NOT coming from this program.
Unfortunately a lot of other software does come with undesirable adware or spyware, so if you see something suspicious you may wish to check your PC with an advertising or spyware removal program.

You should not have had to pay any money to obtain PeerProject. PeerProject can be freely downloaded by anyone from http://PeerProject.org/. If you paid someone money for PeerProject, you should demand a full refund immediately.
We hope you've enjoyed using PeerProject so far. We believe it's the best true file sharing application available.
Unfortunately, a lot of file sharers don't know what they're missing-
If you know someone who would like PeerProject, whether they're a new user or someone still using older software, why not let them know there is a better alternative?
Chances are they'll be grateful you did.

Your downloaded files folder "D:\Autoload\PeerProject\Torrents" is not yet in your library.{n}{n}Including your downloaded files folder in your library makes it easier to view and organise new downloads, and lets you take advantage of advanced PeerProject features such as download verification and automatic upgrading. Placing downloaded files in your library does not necessarily require you to share them: you can choose whether or not to share files independently.{n}{n}Would you like to add your downloaded files folder to your library now?
You have opened a BitTorrent torrent file. Would you like to download its contents, or re-seed it?
To share complete files using BitTorrent they must first be seeded. Once this process is complete the Torrent will appear as a new item in your download list.
As needed| When ratio over 100%| Only when requested| Never
